Even though I'm not exactly a big fan of twist NTR, I'll probably keep following this series unless it stretches for too long.

I like it. But I'm still getting concerned with this because if there's a type of ntr I hate the most it's the twists ones. The author tends to make twist netorare and it really turns me off to the series since. O don't think that's good writing. If you promoted a hentai that's vanilla and stays vanilla for the longest time only for it to be a netorare is just bad. I've seen those before and it really damaged the viewing/reading experience. I'm ok with netorare as a hentai that's promoted as netorare (as long as it is good I wouldn't mind like otomedori). This is kinda concerning since if you look closely at the poster. That guy doesn't look like sensei. He ain't that buff and that tanned oh god. Though if it does turns out well (as a written vanilla with ntr tendencies) I wouldn't mind rating it as 6/10 but if it turns out to be another lazily written netorare like all the netorares we've seen before then it is nothing more but a waste of time. All in all a good chapter 1. 8/10

Looks like this is getting a translation huh. Anyway, a few words here from someone who put up summaries for all chapters so far (you can check the comments of the raw uploads): You should not expect just rainbows and butterflies with this author. At the very least, know this before you follow this series. Also, the title itself is a pretty good indication that it's not all gonna be vanilla. Itaiamai is Itai and Amai combined which means Painful and Sweet respectively. FMC made a reference to this at page 33. Anyway, I'll still post summaries for new chapters since I find this author's work interesting. In case you wanna know, the story still has no NTR nor cheating/swinging just yet. Author is still playing with its audiences since it's still just chapter 3.

On page 69 of 362028, the teacher sees the girl come out from a room with drool coming out from her mouth and a guy comes out right after her. The next page, page 70, the teacher went home and he was depressed thinking about what could've happened. Using google translate on page 74, we find out that it was all just a misunderstanding. That man that came out after her was actually a chef-in-training and all he wanted to do was offer her a drink that he made.
The girl found it cute that her teacher was jealous and so she wanted to apologize for the misunderstanding by having sex.
